content:
Sure, here is a revised summary of the training programs and drills that have been suggested in this thread, including the additional weeks and the top five most effective submissions and chokes:

1. White belt to blue belt BJJ training program:
* Week 1: Guard position
* Week 2: Side control position
* Week 3: Closed guard position
* Week 4: Half guard position
* Week 5: Knee-on-belly position
* Week 6: Mount position
* Week 7: Mount position
* Week 8: Back control
* Week 9: Takedowns
* Week 10: Passes
* Week 11: Submissions
* Week 12: Transitions
* Week 13: Drilling
* Week 14: Sparring
* Week 15: Conditioning
* Week 16: Mount position
* Week 17: Back control
* Week 18: Takedowns
* Week 19: Passes
* Week 20: Submissions
2. Four-week training program focused on submissions, grips, and the kimura:
* Week 1: Fundamentals of submissions, including the top five most effective submissions and chokes: armbar, triangle choke, rear-naked choke, guillotine choke, and kimura
* Week 2: Gi grips and control
* Week 3: Kimura attacks and defenses
* Week 4: Theory and visualization
3. Good drills for BJJ that
